result.execSummary:
Johnathan M Smith was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Johnathan M Smith was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnathan M Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Johnathan M Smith not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for review hearing. Defendant was picked up by the State of Arkansas on 9/19/15. On motion of the State, Court ordered this case closed and took no further action.

Defendant Johnathan M Smith in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for review hearing. Defendant is still serving a 120-day sentence that expires on 9/12/15. Court ordered an additional review date to make sure the requesting state has picked up the defendant. Attorney Stewart is counsel of record but has since left the public defender's office. Clerk to notify SPD that new counsel needs to be appointed. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Review hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court, defendant Johnathan M Smith not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant in custody serving a 120-day sentence.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing.  Parties were advised that as of 8/01/15, this calendar will be reassigned to Judge Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Review hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Johnathan M Smith in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Johnathan M Smith in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Hearing on extradition was able to proceed.   The Court is in receipt of the Governor's Warrant from the city of Little Rock, county of Pulaski, Arkansas and finds that the extradition warrant is appropriate.  Defendant is served with the extradition warrant in court.  Court ordered the defendant remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department and awaiting pick up by the State of Arkansas.  The Court orders case adjourned to make sure that the requesting state has picked up the defendant.  Case continued before Branch 20 to make sure that the requesting state picked up the defendant.  Review hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.  File retained in court.
Governor's Warrant received.  Attorney Stewart is out of the office.  Case is rescheduled to 6/08/15 at 8:30 a.m. for scheduling or possible Extradition Hearing.

Defendant Johnathan M Smith in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel indicated that her client was prepared to waive extradition, hower, upon his arrival at counsel table to sign documents, he refused to sign and is contesting extradition, as the Governors Warrant was not yet received. Court set matter over for a hearing before Branch 20.  Extradition hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Johnathan M Smith in court with attorney Gabriela A. Leija.  Defendant Johnathan M Smith in custody.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of rights and right to file a Writ of Habeas Corpus.  Court found the defendant is the person wanted in the State of Arkansas.  CASE PASSED.  

CASE RECALLED at 3:40 pm.  Defendant contested extradition.  Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Status conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Johnathan M Smith
Current: 4136 North 14th Street, Upper, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 04-04-2015)
Prior: 4136 North 14th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
